dict.string: Check for dupes only if user hasn't disabled the warning
Find duplicate macros names (within a single group) and group names
Select one sample duplicate macro within a single group
Extract all duplicate names within groups
SELECT Group_Name, Macro_Name FROM macros_new GROUP BY Group_ID, Macro_Name HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2 ORDER BY Group_Name, Macro_Name;

array.string: Extract one example same-named macro within a group

dict.string: Format dupe macro name for dialog

Duplicate macro names within a group (Group : Macro): ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ %Variable%local_dupeMacroNames%
Extract all duplicate macro group names
SELECT Group_Name FROM groups_new GROUP BY Group_Name HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2;
+Check for duplicate group and macro names

When two groups, or two macros within the same group, have the same name, Finder must adjust the names when exporting from Keyboard Maestro: Duplicates gain a "2," then "3," etc. MBU cannot discern these names, so some tasks‚ÄîFinder labels and differences comparisons, for two‚Äîwill fail.
But your backups will still run, and all duplicates will be backed up; it's just the analysis and labeling that will fail. All such macros have been identified and saved to the /tmp/dupesdots folder, in a file named:
_Duplicate Macro and Group Names.txt
This folder will be opened in Finder when the macro concludes.
Use this file to remove duplicate names, if you wish, to make the macro's analysis run correctly.
Click Don't Warn Again to block this message in the future‚Äîbut be aware that you'll be missing some analysis. (Click OK to leave the warning in place.)
Warning: There are duplicate group and/or macro names
SQL: Update settings database with new value
Check for invisibles only if user hasn't disabled the warning
Find macros and groups whose names start with a dot
Count the leading-dot-named groups and macros
SELECT (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM macros_new WHERE Macro_Name LIKE '.%') AS MacroNameCount, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM groups_new WHERE Group_Name LIKE '.%') AS GroupNameCount

array.string: Check for leading-dot-named macros and groups

dict.string: Split the results into two vars
Check for leading-dot-named groups and macros
Check if there are such names and take action if necessary
Do nothing as there are no dot-named macros or groups

dict.string: SELECT Group_Name FROM groups_new WHERE Group_Name LIKE '.%' ORDER BY RANDOM() LIMIT 1;

Macro group names starting with a dot: ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ %Variable%local_dotNamedGroups%
Do nothing as there are no dot-named macros

dict.string: SELECT Macro_Name FROM macros_new WHERE Macro_Name LIKE '.%' ORDER BY RANDOM() LIMIT 1;
Extract all dot-named macros as test

Leading-dot macro names within a group (Group : Macro): ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ %Variable%local_dotNamedMacros%

You have %Variable%local_dotGroups% groups and %Variable%local_dotMacros% macros whose names begin with a period (.). A full list of all such macros and groups has been saved to the /tmp/dupesdots folder, in a file named:
_Leading Dot Named Macros and Groups.txt
This folder will be opened in Finder when the macro concludes.
MacroBackerUpper will handle these just fine, backing them up and comparing them with prior backups. However, the groups and macros will be invisible in Finder, as Finder hides files that begin with a period. To see them, either show invisbiles (Shift-Command-Period) in Finder, use Terminal, or rename all such macros and groups.
Click Don't Warn Again to not see this dialog in the future, or OK to leave it in place.
Warning: Some of your files will be invisible
SQL: Update settings database with new value
